div.l: He half a busshel of her mele hath take
And bad his wyf gon knede it in a cake
And seide I trowe þe clerkes were aferd
Ȝit kan a Miller make a clerkes berd
For al her art ȝe lat hem goon her weye
Loo where they goon · ȝe lat þe children pleye
They gete hym nouȝt so lightly by my croıı̄un
Thise sely clerkes / rennen vp and doıı̄un
With keep keep · stand stand · io · sa warderere
Ga whistle þou · / and I sal kepe hym here
But shortly til it was v̉erray nyght
They cowde not þough they dide her myght
Her capil cacche / he ran awey so faste
Til in a dyche / they caughte hym atte laste
Wery and weet as beste is in the rayn
Comth sely Iohn / and wᵗith hym cometh Alayn
¶ Allas quod Iohn þe day þᵗat I was born
Now ere we dryuen til hething ⁊and til scorn
Oure corn is stole / men wol vs fooles calle
Bothe þe wardeyn / and oure felawes alle
And namely þe meller wele away
Thus pleyneth Iohn / as he goth by þe way
Toward þe Melle and bayard in his hond
The Miller sittynge by þe fyre he fond
For it was nyght / and ferther myghte þei nouȝt
But for the loue of god / they hym bisouȝt
Of herberwe and of ese / as for her peny
The Meller seide a geyn ȝif ther be eny
Swich as it is / ȝit shall ȝe haue ȝoure part
Myn hous is streit / and ȝe haue lerned art
Ȝe can by argument make a place
A myle brood of twenty fote of space
Lat se now ȝif þis place may suffise
Or make it rowmer wᵗith speche as is ȝoure gise
¶ Now Symond seide þis Iohn by seint Cuthberd
Ay is þou mery / and þat is fayre answered
I haue herd say / men sal taken of twa þinges
Swilk as he fyndes or take swilk as he brynges
But specialy I pray the hoost dere
